Its really interesting to hear how fx fits within the pipeline and how although there is seperation between them and other departments there is also overlap that allows you to still use skills such as modelling and comp. :simple_smile: 
In terms of the geo is it better to have something built in pieces or as one whole thing. I have models that i've created over the past few years but want to add fx to them in houdini but am unsure if the models have to be made a certain way in order for them to work in houdini?

It depends a bit...but if in doubt, separate them :slightly_smiling_face: . Usually, geometry is separated into its parts if it either needs to be blown off or otherwise come apart from another piece. Or if it's going to be shaded differently/have a different material. Separating makes all this much easier and also insures that IF you take parts off, the parts that remain don't need any extra work to close off any holes left over from any separating action. Does that make sense? Not the easiest to explain in just words :wink:
